New Avenue | Architect | Designer Position

The Role: Senior design team member with a focus on residential projects that transform single family homes into complexes of two or more homes. Typically ADUs and transforming older homes to become family compounds. The architect/designer position is available for a broad range of experience and we encourage any designer who is passionate about changing the future of housing to apply.

Your responsibilities will include working with clients from initial consultations through to completion of construction administration on projects including ADUs and small plexes. Typical projects include house-lifts and detached two and three bedroom ADUs ranging from 400-4000 square feet. You will be responsible for client communication, project management, design work, drafting and detailing, presentations, permitting, and construction administration.

Your Qualifications:

You are passionate about architecture and design, and making our built environment more beautiful, sustainable, and equitable. You enjoy working with people and solving problems using creative design solutions. You are a good listener and communicator, making our clients feel well-cared for and that their needs are being met and problems are being solved beautifully and efficiently.

- Detail Oriented
- Strong Design sensibilities
- Experience in designing ADUs, Custom Homes, and major remodels and additions.
- Have worked on fast-paced, deadline-driven projects
- Enjoy helping your colleagues and together doing the best work possible

Your Activities:

You will be part of the New Avenue design team and will be assigned to a variety of residential projects throughout the California Bay area. This is a fully remote position, but candidates should be comfortable traveling for meeting clients and construction site visits, Covid-safety dependent.

On a day to day basis, this position involves: logging in to our self-developed project management app, following up with client communications, developing project schedules, executing design work, presenting ideas to the internal team and to clients, managing and collaborating with outside consultants, executing design work using Revit and other tools, creating full Construction Documents, fostering the project through the permitting process, and facilitating construction administration services. This requires the capacity to juggle several projects at the same time so you must be adept at project management and disciplined in following a strict project schedule by adhering to deadlines and deliverables.

You will be assigned to your own projects and clients within the NA team under the direction of a senior staff member. This gives you a lot of flexibility and design freedom as well as a lot of responsibility for the success of your projects.

About New Avenue:

New Avenue is a diversified sustainable development company with a leading in-house developed technology, a full-service design–build division and expansive involvement in local and state policy groups that impact housing. We manage residential projects from the initial call through a comprehensive design and construction process. The entire process is centered on the homeowner and our goal is to create a home that will be a source of health, happiness, and value throughout your lifetime and for generations to follow. We do this with a focus on quality, transparency, sustainability and improving the built environment through design excellence.

Our Core Values:

Transparency
We built our process to empower clients, designers and builders with the ability to be honest about the entire development process. We aim to replace the frustrations of unexpected fees, unrealistic budget expectations and schedules with honesty, transparency and a collaborative respectful culture. Using the budgets of real, completed projects as examples, we help you set realistic cost expectations from the beginning. Removing the fear of the unknown to set the creative process free and pursue the best possible design and construction quality. Our proprietary app keeps communication, agreements, invoices, and payments all in one place and accessible from anywhere.

Sustainability
We design homes that address sustainability in three ways: environmental, social, and economic. Two of the most important factors in a sustainable healthy home is where you live and who you live with. We design to maximize quality of life - both for our client, our neighborhoods, and the global environment. First we expand access to ownership in the most sought after neighborhoods, then we design for increased connection to family and neighbors, then we decrease energy use and improve materials.

Design Excellence
We custom design and custom build all projects because each property, client and existing building is unique. Creating new housing in existing cities entails a wide range of architectural styles, uses, and project types.

Remote Work:

New Avenue has been a work-from-from home culture since before the days of Covid. Local site visits and city permitting research is often required to be done in-person, however this is flexible and some fully remote positions are available.

About McGinnis Chen Associates, Inc.

McGinnis Chen Associates, Inc. (MCA) is a building enclosure consulting firm comprised of Architects, Engineers, and former Contractors. MCA was founded in 1963 and has offices in San Francisco, Southern California, and Sacramento. MCA’s specialty focuses on the building enclosure including waterproofing, roofing, and the buildings skin integration into the entire construction. Water damage is the leading cause of buildings deterioration and construction litigation cases. MCA regularly works for both Architects and Building Owners to help restore and protect both existing and new buildings. Specializing in this field exposes us to a wide range of experiences in the construction industry and also provides job stability.

Our projects and employees are extremely diverse. We work on everything from high-end single family homes to high-rise skyline defining structures. We hire Architects, Engineers, former Contractors, and drafters from various backgrounds to provide a well rounded team. All employees are exposed to a myriad of professional experiences including design, drafting, peer review, bidding consultation, construction administration, forensic investigations, construction litigation support, and building enclosure testing. Employees gain valuable experience. Our firm emphasizes flexible work schedules, fostering independence, and a healthy and happy work environment. Employees gain experience and develop a professional network through an office environment that promotes open collaboration.

MCA offers competitive salaries and benefit packages. We promote personal growth and training. MCA has licensed professionals on staff that can also support you on your path to licensure. We encourage all employees to seek licensure and certification in a variety of ways and to join professional organizations.

We are currently looking for somebody to join our diverse and knowledgeable team in San Francisco as they are developing into a young Architect or Engineer.

About the Position

Seeking new team members to be involved with all phases of the design and construction process, including producing design documents, visiting and observing construction sites, investigating building assemblies, and communicating with clients, contractors, city building officials and other design professionals. We value team members with a strong interest in learning, the ability to think critically to solve problems and the ability to clearly communicate those solutions.

Responsibilities of the position will include:

Continually learning how different building enclosure systems work together. This includes foundation and below-grade systems, curtain walls, window and door openings, balcony and roofing systems, as well as typical architectural, structural and mechanical systems.
Communicating with owners, architects, contractors, city building officials and various stakeholders in the building project
Contributing to the production of Construction Documents including drawing sets, detail drawings and specifications.
On-site construction observation and monitoring.
Review Contractor submittals and RFIs.
Forensic investigation of building systems including: water testing, destructive testing, thermal imaging, and sample testing, along with the associated technical reporting.

We don’t expect the right candidate to be an expert in all these areas right away. However, there are qualities and skills that we consider important:

Strong desire to learn and grow
Hands-on approach to learning (we do get dirty)
Strong ability to communicate through drawing (hand sketching, CAD, Blubeam etc.)
Construction knowledge or experience
Strong spatial visualization skills, ability to visualize how materials and systems integrate with each other in three dimensions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Self-motivated, willing to work independently as well as collaborate with a project team
Software proficiencies:
AutoCAD / Revit
Microsoft Office
Bluebeam
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in an Architect/Engineering or associated field (Architecture, Structural Engineering, Civil Engineering, Construction Management etc.)

Under the direction and supervision of the Manager of Architecture, the Associate Architect will develop and coordinate the design and construction of capital projects, which include renovations, expansions and additions to the facilities and its infrastructure. The Associate will provide full architectural services, with an emphasis on Interior Design, to support the mission statement of UCSF Health.

The goal of the Architecture and Planning Unit is to create an environment which is operationally reliable and efficient, comfortable for patients and their family and functionally smart and clean. The Associate Architect will work closely with the Director of Architecture & Planning and the Director of Project Delivery to develop designs that will reflect these ideals. They will assist in the selection of consultants and coordinate their work; develop equipment/furniture information; review the documents with user groups, facility engineers and other technical staff of the Medical Center and review the project documents with appropriate enforcing agencies and obtain necessary approvals. The UCSF Health, Department of Planning Design & Construction is responsible for providing comprehensive capital project delivery services to the inpatient, ambulatory and hospital administrative units on the Parnassus, Mt Zion, Mission Bay and satellite campuses in San Francisco and throughout the greater Bay Area. Project types include infrastructure & technology upgrades, renovations and upgrades of diagnostic, imaging and treatment facilities, full floor renovations of inpatient units and remodels of clinical, administrative and outpatient facilities. The Health Capital Project Management group is responsible and accountable to assure projects are delivered on time and within budget, that the design solutions are appropriate, that public contracting laws and codes are respected, the safety of patients and staff is maintained, and that all furnishings, equipment, IT support is in place and active when the project is delivered. Company Description


San Francisco Public Works has a far-reaching portfolio with a $352 million annual operating budget, an active capital portfolio that exceeds $3 billion and a workforce of 1,600-plus employees. Thank you for asking! Kindness and curiosity are some of Atelier Ten’s core tenets.
We are a team of environmental and lighting designers championing for a healthier planet leveraging our vast, collective knowledge of sustainable spaces. We help bring beauty and efficiency to every building, because like Maybelline, not all buildings are “born with it.” We work with architects, engineers, owners, and other stakeholders to accomplish their sustainability, wellness, functionality, and visual goals. We don’t just follow the trends of the industry, we trailblaze new paths to create high performance, sustainable, and award-winning buildings.

What is this role on a high level?
Let’s take a moment to see the overview of the role before we get into the nitty gritty.
We want you to be Atelier Ten San Francisco’s newest full-time Design Staff. In this role you will work within your project team to analyze design options and make recommendations on daylighting, energy systems, water use, thermal comfort, occupant health, sustainable materials, and more. You’ll also work on LEED program administration, which includes analyzing feasibility of specific credits as well as managing the overall documentation process.

What your day-to-day looks like
Days at Atelier Ten are filled with a large variety of project types from offices, labs to large masterplans. We promise to keep you challenged and never bored. Here are some regular tasks you may encounter:

Authoring project deliverables such as reports, memos, and technical reports.
Creating graphic illustrations, drawing from our various technical practices
Client communication
Partnering with Atelier Ten’s technical analysis teams to support your projects
Work on multiple types of projects within the built environment ranging from institutional to commercial to residential building projects as well as large scale masterplans.
Collaborate Atelier Ten’s integrated design groups to support the full range of our services, which include environmental design consulting, daylight and façade analysis, lighting design and benchmarking.

What we are looking for
Hopefully you’re on board so far and excited about what your days at Atelier will look like. We do have a few items on our wish list for you to become the next great Atelier Tenner. We are looking for someone who is curious, proactive, self-motivated with an appreciation and willingness to learn on multiple projects. And if we’re not pushing our luck with asks, you ideally will possess:

Bachelor’s or higher degree in a field related to environmental building design, architecture, architectural engineering, and/ or building science
0-4 years’ professional experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign), and Rhino
In addition, skills in software such as “R,” Grasshopper, Radiance, Revit, eQuest, EnergyPlus, IES, D3, or data visualization would be desirable
Demonstrated skills in computer and hand drafting, and sketching proficiency in written and spoken English, and good verbal, inter-personal and writing skills
Experience with LEED or sustainable design is a plus

What to expect from us?

Competitive salary
100% paid medical, dental, and vision benefits
Generous paid time off
Flexible / hybrid work schedule
Emphasis on work life balance
401k matching program
Highly engaged coworkers with a shared hunger for knowledge
Mutual respect and support from colleagues and leadership
Paid Life and Disability insurance
Paid parental leave
Paid volunteer time
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Annual professional development funds
Freedom to contribute ideas and make a personal difference that is not always possible in a large corporate environment
Really good high-fives

Description:


Working Title: Design & Construction Manager

Classification Title: Administrator II

Department Name: Facilities, Planning, Design, and Construction

Time Base: Full-time

Pay Plan: 12 month

Bargaining Unit: M80 (Management/MPP)

Employment Type: MPP – this position is part of the California State University Management Personnel Plan (MPP). No tenure or permanent status can be achieved within the MPP.

Salary Range: Hiring salary is anticipated at $10,000 - $10,834 per month commensurate with education and experience.

Benefits: Premium benefit package includes outstanding health, dental and vision plans; life and disability insurances; pension (CalPERS); tuition fee waiver; and 14 paid holidays per year. See our benefits website for additional information.

Application Deadline: Open until filled. A review of applications will begin Tuesday, October 25, 2022 and the review period may end at any time thereafter.

Position Summary:

The California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime), is seeking a Design & Construction Manager who will report directly to the Director of Facilities Planning, Design and Construction (FPDC). The position will provide assistance, leadership, and management of the design and construction of assigned capital projects on the Cal Maritime campus and satellite properties. Capital projects may include, but are not limited to tenant improvements, renovations, new construction, infrastructure and utilities repairs and upgrades, and landscaping projects. The Project Construction Manager’s typical responsibilities will include:

Perform project management during preconstruction and construction of major capital, minor capital and repair projects including supervising and coordinating the activities of the project team.
Responsible for managing assigned project budgets and schedules. Responsible for on time and on-budget completion of projects, and the quality of construction.
Responsible for reviewing consultant proposals, invoices, and add service requests, to determine validity, ensure costs are fair, and maintain an awareness of cost and schedule impacts.
Responsible for reviewing engineering and architectural drawings and specifications for accuracy and completeness, constructability and building code compliance.
Responsible for obtaining required plan reviews and permits including: State Fire Marshal , Division of the State Architect, plan check agencies for life safety and code compliance, Seismic Peer Review, Mechanical Systems Review and Commissioning Review.
Oversee construction inspections and testing.
Review contractor change order requests, submittals, RFI's, etc., to determine validity, ensure costs are fair, and maintains an awareness of schedule impacts.
Ensure contractor complies with submission of all required close-out documents.

About California State University Maritime Academy:

Established in 1929, California State University Maritime Academy, a campus of the California State University, is the only degree-granting maritime academy on the West Coast. Located on the scenic Vallejo waterfront, the campus serves a student population of approximately 1000 undergraduates and 50 graduate students.

Cal Maritime offers seven baccalaureate degrees in Business Administration, Global Studies and Maritime Affairs, Facilities Engineering Technology, Marine Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Marine Transportation and Oceanography. The undergraduate curriculum includes licensing programs for future merchant marine, coast guard and naval reserve officers. Cal Maritime also offers a Master of Science in Transportation and Engineering Management degree, as well as a number of extended learning programs and courses.

Major Responsibilities:

Project Contract & Fiscal Management

Solicit and review consultant and contractor scope and cost proposals. Produce and participate in project Request for Qualifications (RFQs) and Request for Proposals (RFPs). Participate in the selection of project design, reviewer, inspector and contractor teams that are appropriate to project scope and schedule. Work with CSU and Cal Maritime Departments of Procurement and Budget to review and issue project contract documents. Review add service and change order requests for validity and accuracy. Review consultant and contractor invoices, schedule of values, and payment applications for accuracy.

Design & Permitting Management

Establish and ensure project design and permitting schedules. Review design deliverables including plans, drawings, and specifications. Responsible for obtaining required plan reviews including: State Fire Marshal, Division of the State Architect, plan check agencies for life safety and code compliance, Seismic Peer Review, Mechanical Systems Review and Commissioning Review. Responsible for coordinating with the Campus Architect and Deputy Building Official during all phases of project design and permitting.

Construction Administration & Management

Provide overall Construction administration and management including monitoring contractor operations for conformance to contract documents and applicable codes, review and negotiate contractor claims, oversee work of inspectors and testing agencies, and actively assist contractors and design teams in the resolution of technical and procedural problems. Ensure contractor complies with submission of all required close-out documents. Close out projects by obtaining certification of occupancy and issuing notice of completions.

Utilize the CSU's Job Order Contracting program (JOC) to manage projects. This may include oversight of the Gordian Group as relates to the Cal Maritime’s JOC program. Develop a thorough knowledge of CSU's TO-CA, CM at Risk, and Collaborative Design-Build project delivery models and system wide standards as set forth in the State University Administrative Manual (SUAM).

Required Qualifications:

Advanced degree (Bachelor or higher) in Architecture or Construction Management (or closely allied field) required.
Possession of a valid California Driver's License and the ability to operate a motor vehicle safely required.
Significant (5 or more years) of direct project management experience with comprehensive understanding of the various phases of design and construction, as well as the architecture/engineering/construction (AEC) industry as a whole.
Proven ability to manage multiple concurrent major and minor projects with respect to process, technical, professional and fiscal issues.
Proven aptitude for providing positive customer service requiring a very high level of diplomacy and professionalism. Ability to build and maintain relationships. Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Ability to adapt to change and competing demands.
Superior skills in the financial management of building projects.
Ability to interpret complex design/construction documents and effectively administer design consultant contracts throughout the project. Experience with construction contracts, contract law, public contracting code, and construction claim procedures; ability to draft modifications to standard agreements consistent with CSU policy and in coordination with legal counsel.
Ability to review plans, calculations, and specifications in a rapid, uniform and accurate manner.
Knowledge of current California and California State University laws, codes, standards and ordinances that regulate building design, construction, inspection, health and safety.
Knowledge of construction delivery methods and their strengths and weaknesses including Design-Bid-Build, Construction Manager at Risk, Design-Build, and Collaborative Design-Build. Experience with the risk/reward structure of various types of construction contracts and how a contract's structure supports the project's goals.
Experience managing contractors, including reviewing contract documents, issuing field instructions, and reviewing change order requests, submittals, RFI's, etc.

Preferred Qualifications:

Possession of a LEED AP credential preferred.
Possession of a Certified Access Specialist (CASp) credential preferred.
Possession of a Certified Building Official (CBO) certification issued by the International Code Council (I.C.C.) preferred.
Knowledge of California State University processes, procedures, and familiarity with the State University Administrative Manual (SUAM).
Experience within a higher education setting.
Proficiency in BlueBeam.
Proficiency in Autodesk AutoCAD and/or Revit.
Proficiency in Adobe Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop).
Experience drafting, issuing, and reviewing Request for Qualifications (RFQs) and Request for Proposals (RFPs).
Knowledge of and experience with Job Order Contracting (JOC).
Knowledge of an experience with CSU Task Order Contract Agreements (TOCA).

Special Conditions:

Physical, Mental and Environmental Conditions:

Involves mainly sitting with up to 25% of the activities involving regular standing or walking; involves lifting of medium weight objects limited to 25 pounds.
Is exposed to excessive noise and around moving machinery
Drives motorized equipment
Employee regularly works outdoors and is routinely exposed to sun, may be exposed to extreme heat or cold and rain.
Regularly works on uneven slippery surfaces.

Background Check: Satisfactory completion of a background check (including a criminal records check, DMV records check, credit check and fingerprinting) is required for employment. CSU will make a conditional offer of employment, which may be rescinded if the background check reveals disqualifying information, and/or it is discovered that the candidate knowingly withheld or falsified information. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the continued employment of a current CSU employee who was conditionally offered the position.

Mandated Reporter: The person holding this position is considered a ‘mandated reporter’ under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 revised July 21, 2017, as a condition of employment.

Designated Position: This position is a “designated position” in the California State University’s Conflict of Interest Code. The successful candidate accepting this position is required to file Conflict of Interest forms subject to the regulations of the Fair Political Practices Commission.

Eligibility to Work: Applicants must provide proof of U.S. citizenship or authorization to work in the United States within three days of the date of hire.

At Gensler, we design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We’re not just designers. We’re tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring innovative ideas to solve challenging problems. Our San Francisco studio has a thriving interiors and architectural practice focusing on workplace. Through our integrated inside-out design approach, we impact both the people working in our buildings and the surrounding community with our inspirational and thought leading design solutions.
Gensler is seeking an experienced Design Manager to join our San Francisco team. Diverse higher education and science project experience preferred, including interiors, architecture, master planning and pre-design services. We are collaborative and client focused, with a commitment to design experience, sustainability, and equity. Join us, and work collaboratively with our leadership team to help grow our practice in San Francisco and the NW region.
Your Role
A Design Manager at Gensler is a self-directed team leader, with excellent communication and technical skills and the ability to deliver projects to a successful completion. He or she will lead clients and project teams through all project phases, driving design excellence and client satisfaction, and acting as the main point of contact for the client. And he or she will mentor junior staff to promote a high level of design and technical proficiency in all work produced.
What You Will Do
Act as hands-on design manager for a variety of projects
Engage clients and stakeholders to identify project vision, goals, and objectives
Work collaboratively with others toward design solutions
Promote engagement and collaboration at all levels, including design team, consultants, clients, and contractors
Manage teams from concept design through construction with a deep understanding of zoning, codes, construction standards, and other regulatory requirements
Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and work plans
Ensure excellent performance regarding project design quality, schedule, and budget
Prepare and review proposals, contracts, and consultant agreements
Work with accounting team to manage the billing process
Participate in firm marketing, proposal writing, and project interviews
Mentor, coach and manage junior/intermediate staff
Contribute to general office-wide initiatives, external thought leadership, and marketing efforts
Support firmwide sustainability and resilience goals, and drive high performance solutions
Support diversity, equity, and inclusion goals on projects and within the office
Develop and maintain positive client relationships
Your Qualifications
10-15 Years of Design Management experience in an Architecture firm
Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture required, Master’s Degree preferred
Track-record of success with education, sciences, civic, and other mission-driven institutional projects
Knowledge and experience in all phases of interior design and architectural projects
Strong user engagement, programming, and pre-design planning skills a plus
Ability to provide excellent client service and assure project profitability
Collaborative spirit and desire to mentor junior/intermediate staff
Knowledge of state and local building codes including accessibility
Sustainable design experience, including hands-on experience with LEED, LBC, and other certification systems
Computer skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and Project), and AutoCAD required
Revit, SketchUp and Photoshop skills are a plus
Life at Gensler

Arcadis offers opportunities to work on exciting and diverse projects across all sectors. To learn more about our workstyle promise, life as an Arcadian and to explore other career opportunities with Arcadis, visit our careers page here .


Role description:

As an Architect you will work as part of the Places Design and Engineering team and be responsible for the development of deliverables across the entire spectrum of base bid design services, including programming, concept design, schematic design, detailed design, permitting, construction documents and construction administration services. Work in these design phases would be across a variety of construction project types (for both Private and Governmental clients), doing light and heavy Industrial Market Sector work such as, but not limited to, Automotive, Food & Beverage, Life Science, Oil & Gas, Chemical, and Conglomerates.



Role accountabilities:

Working with Project Manager and other Engineering Disciplines to prepare design presentations and produce documents.
Coordinating with other discipline leads including (CIVL, STRU, MECH, ELEC, PLMB, FLS, WWTR, etc.) to provide an Integrated Project Delivery (IPD).
Programming, Master Planning, Concept Design, SD, DD, & CD design activities (depending on a project’s design phase )
Developing designs in coordination with client’s requirements, specifications, and goals.
Communicating design ideas through the use of sketches, and computer design tools such as REVIT/
Additional skill set in these software platforms is a plus: BIM360, AutoCAD, & Enscape
Generating technical drawings and technical specifications such as floor plans, sections, elevations, detail, and schedules to convey design intent and criteria.
Facility Code Analysis and Life Safety Analysis
Development of Quantity takeoffs, of facility components, for Arcadis Cost Estimates to provide pricing and cost estimates
Assisting the project team during the construction phase by reviewing RFIs, shop drawings submitted material samples.
Ability to travel with over night stays, periodically (approx. 25% a year) within North America

Qualifications & Experience:

Key Skills & Experiences:

Experience preparing/developing technical documents.
Proficiency in Drawing and Modelling Software Applications:
Specifically: REVIT & AutoCAD
Additional skill set in these software platforms is a plus: UNIFI, SpecLINK, and e-SPEC
Experience in development and willingness to support BIM standards and SOPs.
Experience in BIM modeling and Architectural Documentation
Experience with industrial and commercial facilities design and construction
Permitting and AHJ Plans Examination Experience.
Experience with Maximum Allowable Quantity (MAQ) Analysis
Proficient in component detailing including interior fit & finishes, doors & door hardware, building envelope, & roofing. Etc.)

Required Qualifications:

A Bachelor of Architecture degree from an accredited school.
5 years of facility design experience in a professional company setting where Architectural/Engineering design services were performed and billed.
Current Registered Architect Licensure in any State of Canadian Province

Preferred Qualifications:

A graduate level (masters) degree in Architecture, Business Administration or another field
PMP certification
An NCARB record on file or a completion certificate of the IDP Program
Licensed Registered Architect (RA) or currently pursuing their professional licensure
LEED AP or BREEAM Certified.

Why Become an Arcadian?

Our work with clients has a direct impact on people’s lives and on the planet. We make moving, living and belonging in cities safer, more resilient and more sustainable. By partnering with our clients as responsible custodians of our earth's resources, we can create a sustainable planet.

We continue to think of new ways to make positive impacts and create better experiences for people; data driven and digital solutions have become part of the Arcadis DNA.
